name: Blessed Alchemical Item
desc: A blessed alchemical item is an alchemical item that restores hit points and was Crafted by a character with the Bless Tonic feat. After you regained Hit Points using a blessed alchemical item, the overflowing energy grants you negative resistance 5 for 1 round, or negative resistance 10 if the crafter is legendary in Crafting.

name: Adapt Self
desc:
You have made subtle changes to yourself to adapt to the situation. Choose one of the following options that applies to you.

If you are in water, you gain a swim Speed equal to half your Speed.
If you are in water, you become able to breathe water.
If it's too dark for you to see, you gain darkvision.
If you are in an environment of severe heat or severe cold, you are protected from the effects of severe heat or severe cold, and the spell lasts 10 minutes.

hints.desc: You are able to breathe water.
You are protected from the effects of severe heat.
You are protected from the effects of severe cold.

name: Agitate
desc: Your mind and body are sent into overdrive, forcing you to become restless and hyperactive. During the duration, you must Stride at least once each turn or take |dice=var1 Mental| var1 mental damage that turn. The duration depends on your Will save. Critical Success The spell has no effect. Success The duration is 1 round. Failure The duration is 2 rounds. Critical Failure The duration is 4 rounds.

Critical Success The spell has no effect. Success The duration is 1 round. Failure The duration is 2 rounds. Critical Failure The duration is 4 rounds.

desc: The caster has transposed the moment that you would be injured to later in your timestream. name: Eject Soul
desc: The connection between your body and soul has been disrupted, possibly forcing your soul out of your body altogether. You are affected according to your Fortitude save. If you are an ally of the caster, they can allow you to choose the degree of success instead of rolling a saving throw. Success You are unaffected. Failure You are stunned 1 as your soul briefly loses its connection to your body. Critical Failure Your soul exits its body for 1 round. var1Your body becomes stunned. While your body is stunned in this way, you remain fully aware in soul form; you simply can't consciously move your body (though the body makes basic instinctual defensive movements). Your soul has the incorporeal trait, is invisible, and has a fly Speed of 60 feet. You can't attack, cast spells, or attempt any skill checks that require a physical body, and you must always maintain line of effect to your body. When your body ceases being stunned, your soul instantly returns to your body as you wake.

name: Hyperfocus
desc: Your senses are sharpened, though more distant objects become hazy, indistinct, or muted to you. You gain a +1 status bonus to Perception checks attempted with any of your precise senses. Furthermore, any imprecise senses you have are sharpened to precise senses (though they do not receive the status bonus). However, you cannot perceive anything beyond a range of 20 feet with any of your senses. The duration is determined by your Will save. Critical Success You are unaffected. Success You are affected for 1 round. Failure You are affected for 1 minute. Critical Failure As failure, but you cannot perceive anything beyond a range of 10 feet.

name: Ill Omen

name: Message Rune
desc: You have recorded a message up to 5 minutes long and inscribe a special rune on any flat unattended surface within reach. The nature of the rune's appearance is up to you, but it is visible to everyone and it must be no smaller than 2 inches in diameter. You have also specified a trigger that creatures must meet to activate the rune. For the duration of the spell, creatures who meet the criteria of the trigger can touch the rune to hear the recorded message in their head as though you were speaking to them telepathically. You know when someone is listening to the message, but you do not know who is listening to it. You can Dismiss the spell.

name: Oathkeeper's Insignia
desc: A magical indicator assures a creature that you've upheld your end of a bargain. When you Cast the Spell, you created a bracelet, flower, or other such trinket. If, while the spell persists, you complete the terms of the promise or deal you made, the trinket fades away with a pleasant chime; if you violate the terms instead, the trinket breaks with a dissonant crash.

name: Object Memory
desc: By touching an object, you have drawn forth the experience of those who created and used it. If you touched a weapon, your proficiency rank with that weapon temporarily increases to <var>var1</var> (if it is not already higher). If you touched a tool, your proficiency rank with the next skill check you attempt with that tool (such as a Crafting check with a blacksmith's hammer) within the spell's duration temporarily increases to <var>var1</var> (if it is not already higher). This spell has no benefit for activities that take longer than a minute to complete.

desc: Glowing letters assemble in the air, providing a transcription of your speech in all languages that the caster speaks. For the spell's duration, any words you speak aloud are spelled out in letters in front of you. The caster has chosen whether these letters are visible to all creatures or only certain creatures they specified. Any words you mouth silently are similarly spelled out, allowing you to communicate silently or in areas where sound doesn't carry. name: Reflective Scales
desc:
You have grown a set of colored glowing scales or scaled armor that stores energy before releasing it in a final burst. When you cast this spell, choose acid, cold, fire, electricity, or poison damage. You gain resistance <var>var1</var> against that type of damage. The scales' color depends on the damage type you chose and is usually the color of a type of dragon or other creature associated with that damage type, such as red or gold for fire damage.

The scales store up energy as they protect you. Keep track of how much damage the scales have prevented. As a 2-action activity that has the concentrate and manipulate traits, you can explode your scales outward in a 20-foot radius around you, dealing |dice=1d6| 1d6 damage of the chosen type to all creatures in the area for every 10 damage the scales have prevented, to a maximum of |dice=var2| <var>var2</var> damage (after preventing <var>var3</var> damage). Once you do so, the spell ends.

The impressive roar grants you a +2 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy checks for 10 minutes against dragons that were in the area at the time of casting. All enemies within the area other than dragons are affected according to their Will save; to these enemies, roar of the wyrm is a fear effect. Critical Success The creature is unaffected. Success The creature is frightened 1. Failure The creature is frightened 2. Critical Failure The creature is frightened 3 and fleeing for 1 round. Roar of the wyrm affects non-dragon creatures with deep ties to dragonkind (such as a barbarian with the draconic instinct, a sorcerer with the draconic bloodline, or a member of a culture that reveres dragons) as if they had the dragon trait. The GM decides if a creature is aligned enough with dragonkind to be affected in this way.

name: Stasis
desc: The flow of time congeals around you, holding you in place. You are affected according to your Will save. Critical Success You are unaffected. While in stasis, you can't be moved, and you remain fixed in place, defying gravity if need be. Critical Failure As failure, but you are held in stasis for 3 rounds.
